title: IRTRANS_SND_4 Function Module
description:
IRTRANS_SND_4 allows users to send remote control commands to the IR￾Trans. If IN_x is TRUE the specifed device and key code in setup is sent to

the IRTrans which outputs in turn as a real remote control commands. With

T_REPEAT the repeat time for sending can be specifed . If IN_0 remains

constant to TRUE so always this key code sent repeated after the time

T_REPEAT. If a change to a diferent IN_x occures this code will send imme￾diately and then again delayed with T_REPEAT, if it remains a long period

of time. At output KEY the currently controlled KEY will be displayed. KEY

= 0 means that no IN_x is active. The values 1-3 are the IN_0 - IN_3.
name: IRTRANS_SND_4

input.name: IN_0
input.description: If TRUE, sends the key code x to the IRTrans.

input.name: IN_1
input.description: If TRUE, sends the key code x to the IRTrans.

input.name: IN_2
input.description: If TRUE, sends the key code x to the IRTrans.

input.name: IN_3
input.description: If TRUE, sends the key code x to the IRTrans.

input.name: T_REPEAT
input.description: Time interval to re-send the key code.

input.name: IP_C
input.description: Data structure containing parameterization information for IP control.

input.name: S_BUF
input.description: Data structure to transmit network buffer.

input.name: DEV_CODE
input.description: The name of the remote control to be decoded.

input.name: KEY_CODE_0
input.description: Key code to be sent when IN_0 is active.

input.name: KEY_CODE_1
input.description: Key code to be sent when IN_1 is active.

input.name: KEY_CODE_2
input.description: Key code to be sent when IN_2 is active.

input.name: KEY_CODE_3
input.description: Key code to be sent when IN_3 is active.

output.name: KEY
output.description: Displays the currently controlled key. KEY = 0 means no IN_x is active; values 1-3 represent states of IN_0 to IN_3.
